data.text:
Millions of people are familiar with the legendary rapper Eminem. The rapper hasn't been on the headlines only due to his songs but also for his volatile relationship. Kim Scott Mathers, Eminem's ex-wife now, is the woman whom he has divorced not once but twice.

Kimberly is an American-born writer and mercenary illustrator. Kim has written several children's books, but this didn't bring her to the limelight as much as her turbulent relationship did. The relationship between Eminem and Kim has been a rollercoaster of emotions with the pair ending up calling it quits.

Kimberly Ann Scott profile summary

Full name: Kimberly Ann Scott

Date of birth: 9th January 1975

Place of birth: Warren, Michigan, U.S.A

Age: 45 years

Nationality: American

Ethnicity: Caucasian-white

Religion: Christianity

Profession: Writer, illustrator

Marital status: Divorced

Current residence: Detroit, Michigan, U.S.A

Net worth: $2 million

Kimberly Ann Scott biography

Kim was born on 9th January 1975 as Kimberly Ann Scott in Warren, Michigan, in the United States of America. Her parents are Casimer Sluck (father) and Kathleen Sluck (mother). She had a twin sister named Dawn Scott, who passed away in early 2016 at the age of 41 due to heroin overdose. The twin sisters were brought up by their mother and step-father.

Kim and Dawn had a rough time growing up as they had to deal with an alcoholic step-father who even assaulted Kimberly sexually. The two couldn't take it anymore, and they fled home and began living at Youth home in 1998. Later on, Kim met the rapper, and they moved to his mother's house.

Eminem and Kim Scott relationship

Kim and Eminem met for the first time at a friend's house party where Eminem saw Kim singing. At that time, Eminem was 15 years, while Kim was just 13 years old. After knowing each other for some time, Eminem invited Scott to go live with him in his mother's house.

The duo had an on-and-off relationship, which forced Kimberly to move out with her daughter Hailie just after her birth. A few years later, the relationship was on, and Kim and Eminem reconciled and tied the knot in 1999.

The marriage was faced with numerous challenges that made the duo hate each other even more. It was so bad that the rapper composed songs to express his dislike for Kim. He released the jam, Kim, in 2000, which was aimed at expressing his intense fury towards his wife.

Kimberly was caught kissing his husband's mutual friend and rapper, John Guerra. The occurrence got Eminem enraged to the point of attacking Guerra, who filed a lawsuit against him. As a result, Eminem was sentenced to two years of probation. Kim's husband referenced the incident in his jam dubbed the Kiss from his 2002 album titled The Eminem Show. Two years later, the couple ended their marriage in divorce.

The court finalized the divorce by authorizing that Kim and Eminem would enjoy shared custody of their daughter. In the divorce decree, Eminem was ordered to pay $1,000 per week, which is equivalent to $52, 000 per year to his ex-wife for child support.

From the frying pan to the fire

Later on, Eminem performed the track dubbed Kim on-stage in his Up in Smoke Tour. In his performance, the rapper was assaulting a blow-up doll, which he used as a representative of his ex-wife. This was super torturous to Scott that she attempted suicide by slashing her wrists. Even though Kim survived the attempted suicide, it marked the beginning of a series of disastrous events in her life.

Due to desperation, Kim turned to drugs. In the year 2001, she was arrested for possessing drugs. In 2003, she received court charges after she was caught driving under the influence. Ann was fined and kept on probation. What did Eminem ex-wife go to jail for? Kimberly violated the terms of her probation. She was once again arrested, and the courts ruled a jail term of one month.

Eminem and Kimberly tied the knot again in 2006, following the release of Kim. Soon after, the duo separated after staying together for three months. Kim was able to handle the second divorce in a better manner than the first one, even though she claimed that the marriage was a rush decision.

In 2016, the news of Kimberly's twin sister's death broke her to pieces that she attempted suicide for the second time. Anne Scotts drove her Escalade into a pole but got lucky enough to survive the crash.

Kimberly Anne Scott children

On 25th December 1995, Kimberly gave birth to their firstborn daughter Hailie Jade while the duo was still living at Eminem's house. After her divorce with the rapper, Anne dated Eric Harter, and they bore an adorable daughter, Whitney.

Kimberly Anne Scott and Eminem have custody of Dawn Scott's child Alaina.

Net worth

Anne Scott has had a successful career as an author and mercenary illustrator. As a result, she has been earning handsomely from her hard work. As of 2020, he net worth stands at $2 million.

Eminem's ex-wife now

Where is Kim Eminem's ex-wife now? Kimberly and the rapper are living separately, but they have maintained a close relationship as co-parents to their children. Kim also admitted that Eminem has continued to be the best possible father to their kids.

On the other hand, Eminem has come out to apologize for being a bad husband through his album dubbed Revival.

Quick facts about Kimberly Ann Scott

Her parents divorced when Kimberly and Dawn were young, and therefore they were raised by her mother and step-father.

Eminem, Dawn, and Kimberly attended Lincoln High School.

Kim received a $900 fine for the offence of driving under the influence.

Kim sued Eminem for releasing the song dubbed Kim, asking the court to stop the rapper from abusing her in singing.

Kimberly has a son by the name Parker Scott although she hasn't given any details about the kid's father.

Kimberly Anne Scott, Eminem's ex-wife now has had a rough love life marked with recurrent marriages and divorces. We can't help but wonder what the future holds for the duo. Will they reconcile and remarry for the third time?
